poem:
Title: "Chess Moves on the World's Board"

In shadows, Kremlin's chilly growl,
Warns of looming winters, foul.
Tit-for-tat, a brittle dance,
At the precipice of finance.
Symbols of power, stark, severe,
Each move breeding palpable fear.
Treasures seized, a country bleeds,
While the world waits and reads.
The chessboard set, pieces hold,
A cautionary tale, foretold.
prompt: You are the poet Carol Ann Duffy. You woke up this morning feeling reflective. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Russia warns US and Europe over reports Ukraine may get its seized assets The Kremlin has threatened Europe and the US with “serious consequences”, including tit-for-tat financial seizures or even a break in diplomatic relations, if Russian assets held abroad are given to aid the Ukrainian budget and war effort. A spokesperson for Vladimir Putin told reporters on Friday that if the Biden administration and European leaders planned to seize Russian central bank assets believed". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
